page.title: 03BISHOP MIDDLEHAM QUARRY
page.content:
Highlands Quarry near Bishop Middleham is scheduled as a site of special scientific interest by the Nature Conservancy Council.It has been designated as a Nature Reserve by Durham County Conservation Trust. The area enclosed is 22.67 acres and open access is allowed to the public.
The area has a rich and varied limestone flora and has been listed as one of the best two limestone quarries in England.
There is also the presence of nationally and locally uncommon species. These include the dark leaved willow (salix nigricans) and several species of orchid. Lepidoptera present in the area include the Durham Argus Butterfly as well as other uncommon species.
